text:
A clearing opens amidst the mire, ringed by massive bone pilesâ€”twisted, hollow, and all facing inward. The bonfire here is low, but it burns steady. Strange symbols are carved into nearby rocks, their meanings long lost, but their warnings palpable.

You sit, not to rest, but to remember. Yet memories elude you. Instead, images rise unbidden: a blade wreathed in screams, a crown made of teeth, a pact sealed in fire and regret. You do not know whose past you hold, only that it burns just beneath your skin.
lore: These bones belong to no creature known. The Mireborn Serpent was once a child of the marsh, gifted with foresight. When it saw what was to come, it devoured its own kin in grief and madness. Now it waits for one who can end its seeing.
